properties.tree_description:
None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Approximately 6 feet of codominant stem structure with bark inclusion, likely originating from basal sprout development, with embedded wire present within the included union; two cavities present on the same stem, including a large historic limb breakout beyond the branch protection zone with associated internal decay, and a higher trunk cavity exhibiting active exudate consistent with a bleeding canker and localized necrotic tissue; surface cracking and bark separation present.
		
		
			Tree number:2Species:Oak Tree Size (DBH):35Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Tree exhibits overall canopy decline with observable previous breakouts; significant rear-stem canker with visible decay and wood loss, cavity-like in presentation and likely associated with a historic large limb failure; fungal fruiting body previously observed at base.

properties.tree_description:
None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Tree 1 is a 33-inch oak exhibiting structural root plate impact. Land disturbance is evident
around the base of the tree. Multiple mechanical wounds are present within the basal area,
including one larger wound at the base of the trunk and several additional wounds along the
lower trunk and buttress roots, with incipient decay present within portions of the damaged
tissue.
This tree has sustained several large limb failures. The root plate is growing over the concrete driveway, which is over 50% of the root plate under impermiable surface.

Pine treeReason for Removal:OtherComments:We do not know the size of the tree.  Requesting removal because it poses a risk to surrounding structures and property.
